summary: This is an Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting an interview with attorney Reid Weingarten regarding deceased inmate Jeffrey Epstein. Weingarten, representing Epstein's estate, invoked attorney-client privilege and declined to be interviewed by the OIG.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.role: Attorney at Steptoe and Johnson LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein's estate who was interviewed by the OIG and invoked attorney-client privilege on behalf of the estate, declining further interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased federal inmate at Metropolitan Correctional Center New York whose estate is represented by Reid Weingarten and has invoked attorney-client privilege.

connections.description: Weingarten represents Epstein's estate and invoked attorney-client privilege on its behalf during the OIG interview.

events.title: OIG Interview of Epstein's Attorney
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General interviewed attorney Reid Weingarten regarding deceased inmate Jeffrey Epstein, but Weingarten invoked attorney-client privilege on behalf of Epstein's estate and declined to be interviewed.

keyFacts: Reid Weingarten, attorney at Steptoe and Johnson LLP, was interviewed by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein's estate invoked attorney-client privilege and was not willing to be interviewed by the OIG at the time of this document.
The document is an OIG memorandum of investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) from the New York Field Office.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
